revised_title: Investigating the Strength of Metals on a Sub-Micrometre Scale
tldr: The authors conducted various experiments to measure the strength of metals on a sub-micrometre scale, using techniques like indentation, blunting, compression of small crystals, and bending of thin filaments. They observed that the yield stress decreased with plastic strain in all experiments, and the maximum strengths were higher than previously calculated values. The results suggest that dislocation generation in small volumes may involve a source mechanism other than the Frank-Read type.
